results.firPara: Jürgen Klopp has said he will pursue signings who are interested in Liverpools progress more than financial might and his existing squad could cover Sadio Manés departure to the Africa Cup of Nations. The Liverpool manager is keen to strengthen his attacking options in January with Senegals Mané bound for Gabon and Danny Ings out for the season with a serious knee injury. But he insists Liverpool will not be seeking a short-term solution or held to ransom by potential targets in the often difficult winter window.
results.secPara: Klopp said It is not only China that is looking for good players but a lot of other clubs, and they might have more money to offer. I can say we dont want to convince players with money. We want to convince them with the way we go. We want to have players who are ready to develop and its not a message for the winter transfer window – its a message for the next few years. We have already really good players and if someone wants to be a part, they are welcome.
results.webTitle: Liverpool will use progress not money to attract players – Jürgen Klopp

results.firPara: Pep Guardiola says Manchester City are unlikely to be spending big in the January transfer window and would be happy to complete the season with the present squad.
results.secPara: Im happy with what we have, I have confidence in the players, the City manager said. Im not saying we wont do anything in the window, you never know what might happen in a week or two, but at the moment we have no plans for a major signing. We can work with what we have and if we finish the season with these players that will be good.
results.webTitle: Manchester City unlikely to spend big in transfer window, says Pep Guardiola

results.firPara: Burnley may decide not to re-sign Joey Barton after it was revealed the midfielder is facing a hefty fine and suspension having been charged by the Football Association for misconduct after allegedly placing 1,260 bets over a 10-year period.
results.secPara: Barton this week agreed a deal in principle to join Burnley – with whom he won promotion to the Premier League last season – in the January transfer window until the end of the current campaign, but the club have now indicated the player may not become a member of their squad next month after it was alleged by the FA that he placed bets between 26 March 2006 and 13 May 2016.
results.webTitle: Joey Barton’s Burnley move in doubt following FA misconduct charge

results.firPara: Data and statistics from the Guardians top 100 list which league and nation is out in front, who got the most No1 picks, plus the oldest, youngest and more
results.secPara: Data and statistics from the Guardians top 100 list which league and nation is out in front, who got the most No1 picks, plus the oldest, youngest and more
results.webTitle: World's best footballers and where they play: the numbers crunched

results.firPara: One of the most remarkable things about Christmas is its basic reach, the layers of ritual and habit, the way this very special time of year manages to smear itself like a basting of goose fat across every one of the vital senses. Overwhelmed by these ruddy-cheeked riches, it can be a tricky choice. We all have our preferences. But in the end its really just a personal choice which part of Christmas you hate the most.
results.secPara: The list is endless. Motorway gridlock. Men who use the word Chrimbo. Adorable bright-eyed, husky-voiced, bowl-headed American children in family movies whose hearts are full of Santa and joy, and who will within the next five to six years appear in Nevada county sheriff mugshots looking glazed and insolent (– you wont believe what Timmy McMuffinface looks like now!) and being sued by their own mad parents in supermarket gossip magazines.
results.webTitle: Messi Christmas, the seasonal gift from Barcelona with a dusting of nutmeg | Barney Ronay

results.firPara: Sam Allardyce has arrived at Crystal Palaces training ground to complete talks over succeeding Alan Pardew as manager.
results.secPara: Palace dismissed Pardew on Thursday after almost two years in charge, with Allardyce now expected to take over once he has held talks with the clubs chairman, Steve Parish.
results.webTitle: Sam Allardyce arrives at Crystal Palace’s training ground to ‘complete talks’

results.firPara: José Mourinho has questioned the Premier Leagues fixture policy during the festive period, with Manchester United having to play three games in two days fewer than the leaders Chelsea.
results.secPara: United host Sunderland on Boxing Day, Middlesbrough on New Years Eve and travel to West Ham on 2 January. Chelsea host Bournemouth and Stoke City on the first two corresponding days but then wait until 4 January for the short trip to Tottenham Hotspur.
results.webTitle: José Mourinho questions Manchester United’s Christmas fixture congestion

results.firPara: The young No10 scored two and made one in a thrilling 3-3 draw with Napoli, while 15-year-old Pietro Pellegri made his debut for Genoa
results.secPara: There has been a good deal of bellyaching about delayed flights in Italy over the past few days, after Milans charter for the Supercoppa in Qatar was grounded by a mechanical fault. From a competitive standpoint, their complaints are merited. They will have had one day fewer than Juventus to get over their jet lag and acclimatise to the desert heat.
results.webTitle: Florence anoints Federico Bernardeschi as heir to Roberto Baggio

results.firPara: Arsène Wenger says Mesut Özil is not a special case when it comes to the dirty work of pressing and winning the ball back. Arsenals playmaker was a focus for criticism with clips of him at a walking pace during the defeat at Manchester City highlighted.
results.secPara: I dont give him any leeway when the team doesnt have possession, Wenger said. He has to do his job like everybody else and usually he does it well. Mesut Özil is an important player, a big player, and the big players always respond to criticism on the pitch.
results.webTitle: Arsène Wenger says Mesut Özil not exempt from Arsenal’s dirty work

results.firPara: Who writes cards? Who doesnt party? And who needs a more colourful tree?
results.secPara: Who writes cards? Who doesnt party? And who needs a more colourful tree?
results.webTitle: Football quiz: Christmas quotes – 'best day of the year by far #family'
